verb.description: Cause to cover a larger area; make longer or wider.
examples: the Forest Service plans to extend a gravel road nearly a mile
I nod and extend my hand

verb.description: Exert or exercise oneself to the utmost.
examples: you have to extend yourself to change rather than keep on doing the same thing

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin extendere stretch out, from ex- out + tendere stretch.
